verses.text:
The hand of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and set me down in the midst of the valley which \add was\add* full of bones ,
And caused me to pass by them round about : and, behold, \add there were\add* very many in the open valley ; and, lo, \add they were\add* very dry.\f + \fr 37.2 \ft valley: or, champaign\f*
And he said unto me, Son of man , can these bones live ? And I answered , O Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, thou knowest.
Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones , and say unto them, O ye dry bones , hear the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* unto these bones ; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live :

And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin , and put breath in you, and ye shall live ; and ye shall know that I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
So I prophesied as I was commanded : and as I prophesied , there was a noise , and behold a shaking , and the bones came together , bone to his bone.
And when I beheld , lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above : but \add there was\add* no breath in them.

Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind , prophesy , son of man , and say to the wind , Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Come from the four winds , O breath , and breathe upon these slain , that they may live.\f + \fr 37.9 \ft wind: or, breath\f*
So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived , and stood up upon their feet , an exceeding great army. \p
¶ Then he said unto me, Son of man , these bones are the whole house of Israel : behold, they say , Our bones are dried , and our hope is lost : we are cut off for our parts.

Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Behold, O my people , I will open your graves , and cause you to come up out of your graves , and bring you into the land of Israel.
And ye shall know that I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, when I have opened your graves , O my people , and brought you up out of your graves ,

And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live , and I shall place you in your own land : then shall ye know that I the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* have spoken \add it\add*, and performed \add it\add*, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p
¶ The word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came again unto me, saying ,

Moreover, thou son of man , take thee one stick , and write upon it, For Judah , and for the children of Israel his companions : then take another stick , and write upon it, For Joseph , the stick of Ephraim , and \add for\add* all the house of Israel his companions :
And join them one to another into one stick ; and they shall become one in thine hand. \p
¶ And when the children of thy people shall speak unto thee, saying , Wilt thou not shew us what thou \add meanest\add* by these?

Say unto them, Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph , which \add is\add* in the hand of Ephraim , and the tribes of Israel his fellows , and will put them with him, \add even\add* with the stick of Judah , and make them one stick , and they shall be one in mine hand. \p
¶ And the sticks whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand before their eyes.

And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the heathen , whither they be gone , and will gather them on every side , and bring them into their own land :

And I will make them one nation in the land upon the mountains of Israel ; and one king shall be king to them all: and they shall be no more two nations , neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all:

Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols , nor with their detestable things , nor with any of their transgressions : but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces , wherein they have sinned , and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people , and I will be their God.
And David my servant \add shall be\add* king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd : they shall also walk in my judgments , and observe my statutes , and do them.

And they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant , wherein your fathers have dwelt ; and they shall dwell therein, \add even\add* they, and their children , and their children’s children for ever : and my servant David \add shall be\add* their prince for ever.

Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them: and I will place them, and multiply them, and will set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore.
My tabernacle also shall be with them: yea, I will be their God , and they shall be my people.
And the heathen shall know that I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do sanctify Israel , when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.
